result.execSummary:
The defendant Mychal Anthony Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mychal Anthony Williams in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

  Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 2 time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for one year with the following conditions:
*anger managment classes
*no weapons
*costs, surcharges and fees during term of probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant
*restitution stipulated by the parties in the amount of $290.40 from bail on deposit and balance forthwith  to the victim  Scott C. 
Probation can terminate early if all costs are paid. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Mychal Anthony Williams in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.   State to file victim notification.     Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mychal Anthony Williams in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. LR  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Any additional cash bail posted on this case to be returned to the remittur.

As an additional condition of bail:
No Weapons
No firearms

Defendant Mychal Anthony Williams in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-037

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned to Branch 47  for a Pretrial Conference.
Clerk:  jms
